articles.author: Ashley Strickland, CNN
articles.title: NASA is ready to 'go' for a second launch attempt of Artemis I today
articles.description: The uncrewed Artemis I mission is ready for a second chance at launching on a historic journey around the moon. NASA's launch window opens at 2:17 p.m. ET and closes at 4:17 p.m. ET on Saturday.
articles.content: Turn to CNN for live coverage from Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Saturday afternoon. Space correspondent Kristin Fisher will bring us moment-by-moment reporting from the launch, along with a tea… [+5122 chars]

articles.title: Yes, the government keeps way too many secrets
articles.description: We don't yet know what classified documents and information former President Donald Trump took with him to Mar-a-Lago. Here's what one expert had to say about legitimate secrets versus overclassified cover-ups.

articles.author: Ben Church, CNN
articles.title: Serena Williams has done it all in tennis, but there's so much more to come
articles.description: Twenty-seven years on the professional tour, 23 grand slam singles titles and a plethora of records; Serena Williams is leaving tennis as one of the greatest players to ever grace the court.

articles.title: This city has around 20 days of fresh water left. Officials are racing to find another source
articles.description: A city in New Mexico has about 20 days of fresh water left, and officials there are scrambling to find another source to prevent cancer-causing particles from flowing out of faucets.

articles.description: Former Attorney General William Barr appeared on Fox News to say there is no "legitimate reason" for classified documents to have been at Mar-a-Lago and cast doubt on the idea that they had somehow been declassified.

articles.author: Tierney Sneed and Katie Bo Lillis, CNN
articles.title: Mar-a-Lago search inventory shows documents marked as classified mixed with clothes, gifts, press clippings
articles.description:
The search inventory released showed that classified documents had been mixed in with personal items and other materials in the boxes in which they were stored.
Federal investigators also retrieved more than 11,000 non-classified government documents.

articles.title: Opinion: What's really at stake when top secrets are stored at Mar-a-Lago?
articles.description: The families of those who died while doing undercover work for the CIA come to mind in reading the reports of former President Donald Trump possibly taking ultra-sensitive classified documents, writes Ted Gup.
